bibl.title: Despatch from Daniel R.B. Upton to Lewis Cap, December 22, 1857
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.p: Sir, I purpose showing your Excellency that the commerce of the United States with this place the wilflow of American citizens explore the establishment of an American Consulate at this port.

Seamen have been discharged from their ships against their will twist their 3 months adorance, have sickened died, + once have been left behind in the Colonial Hospital upon their recovery have adventured that their ship had left tin one case taking away the clashes of the seamen.
A case has this come under my usher A. Mr. Lee 20 make of the Back Turk of Salem Map was discharged from his vessel without his 3 months
